summary: Critical Role has slowly taken over my life. Now that they have their own studio and can produce their own content they have...
body:
Critical Role has slowly taken over my life. Now that they have their own studio and can produce their own content they have silently filled up every single day of the week with things to watch. This is the absolute best fucking timeline. I remember some days I couldn’t even get out of bed because of how sad i was but they were there for me on Tuesday’s and Thursday’s, those weirdos that play D&D that make me laugh and kept me going week in and week out.

Now they have the week blanketed with shit to consume. They work so fucking hard for all of us because they love what they do and the community they have garnered.

Thank you to Matthew, Marisha, Laura, Travis, Sam, Liam, Tal, Brian and the rest of the crew under the CR umbrella.

WE LOVE YOU ALL

summary: So the Mighty Nein: - Cut off a man’s hand - Framed a government official for massive domestic sabotage - Killed several people...
body:
So the Mighty Nein:

- Cut off a man’s hand

- Framed a government official for massive domestic sabotage

- Killed several people (I lost count tbh of how many)

- Destroyed a dock

- Shanghaied a man

- STOLE AN ENTIRE SHIP

- Tied up, beat, and threatened a messenger boy with death 

That casual mail theft early on has led to so much massive crime.

tags: i dont know if i make sense
summary: Okay I’ve been thinking about this for a while ever since Caleb got the Periapt of Wound closure...I don’t know about magic...
body:
Okay I’ve been thinking about this for a while ever since Caleb got the Periapt of Wound closure…I don’t know about magic items that well or what needs to be atuned.

What’s been on my mind is if the Periapt needs attunment.

Caleb has that other necklace that keeps him hidden. I wonder if that also needed to be attuned. Would those two things cancel each other out or would it not do anything and both could work at the same time? Someone help me understand things…


So Imagine if Caleb put on that Periapt and the other necklace stopped working and didn’t realize it. I wonder if the search party from Trent (and maybe Astrid) started happening again?

tags: seriously he's such a classy guy
summary:
Even tho only one (1) person has recognized my cosplay, Comic Con Ukraine still was a blast.
I met John Rhys-Davies and he told...
body:
Even tho only one (1) person has recognized my cosplay, Comic Con Ukraine still was a blast.

I met John Rhys-Davies and he told me that I must be a princess because in Maori culture a stripe on the chin is a sign of royal blood. And I melted a little bit.

reblog.comment:

trail.content:
Even tho only one (1) person has recognized my cosplay, Comic Con Ukraine still was a blast.

I met John Rhys-Davies and he told me that I must be a princess because in Maori culture a stripe on the chin is a sign of royal blood. And I melted a little bit.

summary:
Show
          Chapter
        |
        Archive of Our Own
title:
Show
          Chapter
        |
        Archive of Our Own
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Caleb’s plan wasn’t a very good one, but it was better than anything Nott had. Which was nothing. But the longer she eyed the ladder propped up on the ledge above the gate on the other side of the room, the more she doubted they’d get there. No way would the sound of a bottle breaking get all of the Infected away from the gate for long enough for her and Caleb to get to it. More than likely, they’d have to improvise.

 “All right,” Caleb muttered. “Ready?”

“Hold on.” Nott set the broken bottle down and pulled her flask out of her pack. Quickly she unscrewed the top, took a large gulp, and then tucked the flask away and picked up the bottle again. “Okay,” she said through the dull burn of alcohol in her throat.

“Whenever you’re ready,” Caleb told her.

“Okay,” Nott said again, quieter. Then she poked her head above the table, took a deep breath, and threw the bottle as hard as she could in the direction opposite where she and Caleb needed to go.

“Whenever you’re ready,” Caleb told her.

“Okay,” Nott said again, quieter. Then she poked her head above the table, took a deep breath, and threw the bottle as hard as she could in the direction opposite where she and Caleb needed to go.

 “All right,” Caleb muttered. “Ready?”

“Hold on.” Nott set the broken bottle down and pulled her flask out of her pack. Quickly she unscrewed the top, took a large gulp, and then tucked the flask away and picked up the bottle again. “Okay,” she said through the dull burn of alcohol in her throat.

“Whenever you’re ready,” Caleb told her.

“Okay,” Nott said again, quieter. Then she poked her head above the table, took a deep breath, and threw the bottle as hard as she could in the direction opposite where she and Caleb needed to go.

No way would the sound of a bottle breaking get all of the Infected away from the gate for long enough for her and Caleb to get to it. More than likely, they’d have to improvise.

 “All right,” Caleb muttered. “Ready?”

“Hold on.” Nott set the broken bottle down and pulled her flask out of her pack. Quickly she unscrewed the top, took a large gulp, and then tucked the flask away and picked up the bottle again. “Okay,” she said through the dull burn of alcohol in her throat.
